metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8372 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The mad_layer_III function in layer3.c in Underbit MAD libmad 0.15.1b, if NDEBUG is omitted, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) via a crafted audio file. Agostino Sarubbo discovered that libmad incorrectly handled certain audio files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or possibly other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8372` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmad0 - 0.15.1b-9ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmad package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.15.1b-9ubuntu18.04.1').
